text:
It's no doubt that Michelle Obama 
is an incredibly successful woman.

I've recently been reading her book "Becoming" 
where she speaks about her early life growing up

in the South side of Chicago, going on to 
university, meeting Barack Obama and her

experience as the First Lady of the United States.
She is incredibly inspiring, so for today's lesson

we've selected two clips from an interview that 
she did with Oprah Winfrey for you to learn with.

But before we get into it and in 
case you're new here every week we

make lessons just like this one to help you 
learn fast English, without getting lost,

without missing the jokes and without subtitles.
Just like this fan, who says that with our channel

they not only learn lots of new vocabulary 
but how to use it in real life too.

So to join our community with over 3 million 
subscribers make sure you hit that Subscribe

button and the Bell down below so that 
you don't miss any of our new lessons.

We've already seen a few examples 
of connected speech in this lesson,

that is how natives cut and link words 
together, which makes it sound super fast.

This is an area of learning English that my 
students in particular tell me really frustrates

them. And this is why we created our Fluent with 
Friends Course, not only will you learn real

native vocabulary and start to understand this 
fast native speech, but you'll have fun laughing

along with all the jokes while watching Friends.
And the best part is you can try it for FREE

right now with our 3-Part Masterclass.
It's so easy, all you have to do is

click up here or down in the description 
box below to learn more and sign up now.

If you're enjoying this lesson then I highly 
recommend you check out this lesson we made

with Barack Obama. You can click up here or down 
in the description box below to watch it next.
